results.title: The Detour
results.creator_credit: Shelby Leverington, Caroline Mouris and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A film experienced entirely from the point of view of an elderly patient dying in a large hospital. As modern medicine struggles to keep eighty three year old Catherine Hamilton alive she struggles just as hard to die in peace. Each time she thinks she may be able to slip away, the doctors and nurses bring her back with a wonder drug, or a new machine. But Catherine continues to fight to control her own destiny with humour and dignity

results.title: The Decision
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, Larry Gosnel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The conflict arises in the Canadian rural scene where the pressures of rising prices, competitive markets, higher production costs, force farmers to abandon their traditional views of farming as a way of life, for one that places it on high levels of business. Shows how a father, holding on to old ways, and son holding onto new, resolve differences in such a way as to enable them to keep abreast of advancement in agriculture. Based on the short story by Charles Israel.

results.title: The Decision
results.creator_credit: Vera Neubauer and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An experimental film using a mixture of animation and live action which contrasts the fantasy and romantic ideals of the traditional fairy tale with the life of an ordinary woman confined to her home.

results.title: The Days of Whiskey Gap
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The 1870s were years of grave crises in the Canadian West. American whiskey traders were victimizing the Indians. Chief Sitting Bull and his Sioux warriors, fresh from their victory over the US Cavalry, were camped near the Cypress Hills, and the stage was set for tragedy. In 1873, the North-West Mounted Police were established to maintain law and order in the newly acquired North-West Territories. The following summer a courageous expedition trekked 800 miles from Fort Dufferin, south of Winnipeg, to Fort Whoopup, near present-day Lethbridge. The force raised the flag and proclaimed the Queen’s law, ensuring that the Canadian West would not become a lawless American-style frontier. This film brings to life some of the legends of the men in the scarlet tunics.
